intro: Ardisia angucianensis, commonly known as the Anguillan starapple, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Anguilla in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
